Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2016 12:30PM mydogspot wrote: I will be starting T/C on Friday and I tried to talk my oncologist into taxol instead. She insisted on taxotere so I am trying to be resigned to maybe permanent hair loss. Last week I was horrified by the thought but now I just want to get it over with. They also don't want me to use cold caps or ice my hands or feet because they think it defeats the purpose so I will probably be losing fingernails and toenails. Cancer is not a battle it's an endurance marathon. Three months and this will be over.
Posts.Title: Very nervous about TC tanyam Seashells9701

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2016 04:14PM mydogspot wrote: I will be starting this month, after getting a score of 19 on oncotype dx. It looks like I will be doing taxotere. I tried to ask my oncologist if there was anything else I could take after reading about the risk of permanent hair loss but she is adamant about taxotere.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo August 2016? MFalabella Kechla

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2016 05:34PM mydogspot wrote: Going thru this too. For my second surgery they used anesthesia that didnt put me under as much and I had a really bad reaction to it. Nausea and vomiting all night and thru this morning. If you did well with the anesthesia the first time ask if you can have the same stuff again. Really hard to throw up when you've just had a chunk of your boob cut out! They said I didn't need to be as deep this time because I wasn't having lymph nodes taken out.
